metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7206 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The changelog command in Apt before 1.0.9.2 allows local users to write toarbitrary files via a symlink attack on the changelog file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.0.1ubuntu2.5
apt-transport-https - 1.0.1ubuntu2.5
apt-utils - 1.0.1ubuntu2.5
libapt-inst1.5 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.5
libapt-pkg4.12 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1ubuntu2.5').
